intro: Hedeoma marifolia, commonly known as marsh hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and in swampy areas, thriving in environments with abundant water. Its fragrant foliage and white or pale yellow blooms make it a notable component of wetland ecosystems. Hedeoma marifolia plays a role in supporting local insect populations and maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
